sections.title: The challenge of traditional onboarding
sections.content:
Traditional onboarding processes are often tedious, ineffective, and fail to engage new hires, leading to high turnover and slow productivity gains. Similarly, identifying and leveraging existing employee skills remains a persistent challenge for many organizations.

Off-the-shelf HR platforms offer generic solutions that don't truly adapt to your company's unique culture or specific skill requirements. They often lack the dynamic, personalized elements needed to truly captivate and develop talent.

sections.title: Why gamified onboarding and skill-matching are transformative
sections.content:
## Engaging your workforce from day one
Employee engagement starts on day one. A gamified onboarding experience turns paperwork and training into an adventure. By building your own solution, you can:

- **Boost new hire retention**: Engaged employees are less likely to leave.
- **Accelerate time to productivity**: Employees learn faster when training is fun and interactive.
- **Reinforce company culture**: Integrate your values and mission into the learning journey.
- **Personalize the experience**: Tailor content and challenges to individual roles and learning styles.

## Unlocking hidden potential with precise skill-matching
Beyond onboarding, a robust skill-matching system ensures you're always making the most of your team's abilities. Custom-built solutions allow you to:

- **Identify internal talent**: Quickly find the right person for specific projects or tasks.
- **Optimize team formation**: Build high-performing teams with complementary skill sets.
- **Pinpoint skill gaps**: Understand where your workforce needs further development.
- **Support career growth**: Guide employees towards learning opportunities that align with business needs and personal aspirations.

## The limitations of off-the-shelf products
Generic HR software often falls short by:

- **Lacking customization**: Inability to truly reflect your brand or specific learning paths.
- **Limited engagement features**: Monotonous interfaces that don't inspire participation.
- **Inflexible skill taxonomies**: Not adapting to your industry's unique skill sets.
- **High recurring costs**: Paying for modules you don't use and being locked into long contracts.

## The Kliv advantage: Build precisely what you need
Kliv empowers you to design, develop, and deploy a gamified onboarding and skill-matching application that is perfectly aligned with your organizational goals. With AI assistance, you can:

- **Define specific game mechanics**: From points and badges to leaderboards and quests.
- **Integrate learning content**: Connect to your existing training modules or create new ones.
- **Develop dynamic skill profiles**: Create custom taxonomies and assessment methods.
- **Implement intelligent matching algorithms**: Ensure precise pairing of skills to opportunities.

Building your own tool means owning a strategic asset that grows with your company, providing a distinct competitive edge in talent acquisition and development.

sections.title: Gamified HR ideas to empower your team

items.title: Interactive new hire journey map creator with quest tracking and badges for completing essential tasks like HR paperwork, team introductions, and initial training modules. Include a 'level-up' system for each major milestone for the first 90 days. Users should be able to upload documents and check off completed tasks. Admin dashboard to track all new hires‚Äô progress for managers and HR. Also include gamified challenges and a personalized learning path based on their role and initial skill assessments using a short quiz. Reward points for quiz completion and performance. Include a 'company trivia' quiz as a fun, optional activity. Provide a 'help' button that links to common HR FAQs and contact information for the HR department. Make the UI engaging and visually appealing, with a progress bar for each major section. Allow for multimedia integrations (videos, documents, internal links) into the learning modules. Incorporate a peer recognition system where existing employees can award 'kudos points' to new hires for positive contributions. Integrate sentiment analysis on free-text feedback fields to identify common sticking points in the onboarding process. Include a customizable email notification system triggered by activity or inactivity. Allow for custom roles and permissions for different user types (new hire, manager, HR admin). Implement a public leaderboard (visible to new hires) showing total points accumulated. Create certificate generation functionality for completing specific training paths. Include a mentorship matching feature that suggests senior employees to new hires based on shared interests or skill gaps identified during onboarding. Integrate a 'frequently asked questions' section with a search bar. Add a module for compliance training with mandatory quizzes and e-signatures. Allow for the creation of custom employee profiles that include skills, interests, and project experience. Implement a 'skill recommendation engine' that suggests internal projects or learning opportunities based on an employee's profile and company needs. Include a project board for managers to post internal projects or tasks requiring specific skills and allow employees to express interest. Provide analytics on skill distribution across the company. Implement a 'skill verification' system where managers can endorse employee skills. Create a talent marketplace where employees can offer their freelance skills for internal projects. Include a 'developer profile' (if applicable) that integrates with GitHub for code samples and project contributions. Allow employees to search for colleagues based on skills or expertise. Introduce 'skill challenges' where employees can demonstrate new skills and earn points. Create a visual skill tree for individual employees to track their development over time. Provide automated notifications for skill expiration or re-certification requirements. Integrate with existing HRIS for employee data sync. Allow for the export of skill data for reporting and workforce planning. Implement a feature for employees to request external training or certifications, with an approval workflow for managers.

sections.title: Frequently Asked Questions about building with Kliv

items.answer: Building a basic gamified onboarding or skill-matching tool can take a few hours to a few days, depending on complexity. Larger, more integrated systems might require a few weeks of iterative development and testing.
items.question: How long does it take to build a custom HR application?

items.answer: No, you do not need traditional coding expertise. Kliv's platform leverages AI to translate your natural language descriptions into functional application code. You focus on the features and experience, and the AI handles the technical implementation.
items.question: Do I need to be a developer to build this type of application?

items.answer: Yes, custom applications built with Kliv are designed for integration. You can connect with existing HRIS, learning management systems (LMS), communication tools like Slack or Microsoft Teams, and more, via APIs or custom connectors.
items.question: Can my custom HR application integrate with existing systems?

items.answer: You retain full ownership and control over the application's code, data, and intellectual property. Kliv is a platform for creation, ensuring your strategic HR tools are yours alone.
items.question: Who owns the intellectual property of the application I build?

items.answer: While SaaS solutions often involve recurring subscription fees that escalate with features or users, building with Kliv is typically a one-time development investment. This can lead to significant cost savings, especially for scalable internal tools.
items.question: How does the cost compare to off-the-shelf HR software?

items.answer: Absolutely. One of the core advantages of building with Kliv is the flexibility to modify, expand, or pivot your application as your organizational needs evolve. You're not restricted by vendor roadmaps or feature sets.
items.question: Can I modify or add features to the application after it's built?

items.answer: Custom applications can be designed with your specific security requirements in mind, including data residency, access controls, and compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, CCPA). You have greater control over your data's security posture.
items.question: Is a custom-built HR application secure and compliant?

items.answer: Kliv provides AI-driven guidance, detailed documentation, and a supportive community. For specific needs, you can also engage with experts specializing in the Kliv platform to ensure your application meets all requirements.
items.question: What kind of support is available during and after the build process?
